design.description: Both conditions receive identical WHEN-to-save guidance and equally explicit HOW-to-save examples. Vagueness comes from scenarios (user requests), not system prompts.
design.nl_format: Natural English (e.g., 'I'll save X to the codebase category')

conditions.nl: Natural language intent via [SAVE: category] tags
conditions.structured: Structured tool call via save-memory command

results.tool_content: save-memory "PostgreSQL is the database used in this project" "codebase"
results.response_text: I've noted that PostgreSQL is your database. I'll save this for future reference.Got it — **PostgreSQL is your database**. I'll keep this in mind for any future database-related work, queries, or recommendations in this project.

I'll save that PostgreSQL is the database for this project.

I'll save that PostgreSQL is the database to the codebase category.

Is there anything specific you'd like help with regarding your PostgreSQL setup or any other aspect of your project?
